poem:
### Unexpected Triumph

In the shadow of the Alps,  
where whispers of misgivings passed  
through alpine air,  
a pitch of dreams unfurling.  
Stadiums small but hearts vast,  
a tale spun not of fields and grandeur  
but of echoes in valleys,  
where every pass and goal  
bounced off mountain walls,  
singing of unexpected glory.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
